title: Are the Tigrinya speakers in Eritrea and Tigray actually one people, since they share the same language, DNA, culture and history (Aksum, Abyssinia)? - Quora

response.answer_text: As an Aksumite myself with a father who lived in Eritrea for a long time, I can say that Eritrean and Tigreans are very similar, but have their own nuances and dialects. However, there are Tigrinya speakers who are ethnically Tigre, Blen or Kunama. Also, the drastic differences in lifestyle and historical events (Eritrea was an Italian colony) have separated the people even more than the borders do, so most people from both sides do not think about what’s on the other side of the border.
